The Student Loan Borrower Bill of Rights VI: the right to accountability, including timely resolution of problems&errors
The Student Loan Borrower Bill of Rights V: the right to fairness for those who are making a good faith effort to pay
The Student Loan Borrower Bill of Rights IV: the right to consistency when it comes to how monthly payments are applied
The Student Loan Borrower Bill of Rights III: the right to know your servicer&who to contact when there is a problem
The Student Loan Borrower Bill of Rights II: the right to be informed abt the small print&the key terms&conditions of the loan
The Student Loan Borrower Bill of Rights I: the right to payment options such as alternative payment plans to avoid default

The bottom line: our nat’l sec&military leaders have concluded that the risk of keeping #Gitmo open far outweighs the risk of closing it
And today, nearly 12 years after the 9/11 attacks, the architects of the 9/11 attacks are still awaiting trial at #Gitmo
Only 6 individuals have been convicted by military commissions&2 of these convictions have been overturned by the courts #CloseGitmo
Since 9/11, nearly 500 terrorists have been tried&convicted in federal courts&are now being safely held in federal prisons #CloseGitmo
Congress&Admin have kept #Gitmo open too long—prison is against our values, harms our national security&leaves >150 detainees in limbo
By 2006, even President Bush wanted to close #Gitmo &in 2008, the Presidential candidates of both parties supported closing the prison
Every day at #Gitmo, dozens of detainees are being force-fed, a practice that @AmerMedicalAssn & @RedCross condemn #closegitmo
We spend $2.7M/yr for each detainee held at #Gitmo &only $78K to hold a detainee in a fed supermax security prison
Every day that it remains open #Gitmo weakens our alliances, inspires our enemies&calls into question our commitment to human rights
